answers.answer: Hi,Red skin may have differentials like an allergic reaction or a dermatitis. If  sunlight or sun exposure triggers this then a photosensitivity reaction and chronic actinic dermatitis is a differential.How old are you?Do you have any underlying conditions like diabetes ?For how long have you noted this ?What aggravates and relieves your condition ?Do you have any known allergies or a family history of SLE and other rheumatologic disease?

question: Ok, I really have no clue what is going on, but I have always have had red skin.  From my head all the way down to my feet it is light red.  I am not sure if it is a problem but I am just wondering why I am so red?  It doesn't bother me at all I am just wondering.
title: Red Skin
